N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5904.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

For the purposes of this Part: (a) The term foundation shall mean the New

York State Science and Technology Foundation, with headquarters at 99

Washington Avenue, Albany, N.Y. 12210. (b) The term executive director shall mean
the Executive Director of the New York State Science and Technology

Foundation. (c) The term board shall
mean the Board of Directors of the New York State Science and Technology

Foundation. (d) The term Centers for

Advanced Technology Program or CAT Program shall mean the program administered
by the foundation pursuant to which a university or university-affiliated
research institute (or a consortium of such institutions) which conducts, in
collaboration with and through the support of private business and industry, a
continuing program of basic and applied research, development and technology
transfer in one or more technological areas approved by the foundation, may: (1)
apply for designation as a Center for

Advanced Technology; (2)
after
designation as a Center for Advanced Technology, apply for financial support
for the purposes enumerated in section
5904.7
of this Part; or
(3)
apply pursuant to section
5904.9
of this Part for a planning
and program development grant award. (e) The term applicant shall mean a
university or university-affiliated research institute or a consortium of such
institutions filing an application with the foundation for designation, financial support or a planning and program development grant award under the
CAT Program. (f) The term university
as in university or university-affiliated research institute, shall mean an
institution which meets any one of the following criteria: (1)
the title of the institution, as provided
in its charter, includes the term university; (2)
the institution is a higher educational
institution offering a range of registered undergraduate and graduate curricula
in the liberal arts and sciences, degrees in two or more professional fields, and doctoral programs in at least three academic fields; or
(3)
the institution has a significant
established record of research in a technological area identified by the
foundation as suitable for a Center for Advanced Technology. Such an
established record shall be demonstrated by the regular inclusion in the annual
operating budget of the institution of a level of expenditure for research in
the technological field which, in the judgment of the board, is sufficient to
support advanced research of high quality and substantial quantity. (g) The term peer review panels
shall mean those panels composed of nationally recognized experts in the
technological areas and industries to which any application may be related and
which are established by the foundation to review and evaluate applications for
designation as a Center for Advanced Technology or for a grant award under the
CAT Program. Notes
